concept.title: Case 4: Group sharing controls for large enterprise

section.title: Overview
section.p: Corpus is a large enterprise that wants to track the data consumption between its departments and individual employees. The levels of hierarchy in Corpus is as shown in the following figure:

The top-level management is associated with a prepaid bundle for consumption of 1 TB data and unlimited SMS or MMS services. All the levels have unlimited data sharing access. The data consumption is tracked per individual and at the top-level management. When the data consumption exceeds the threshold level defined per individual, an email is sent to the user notifying that the threshold levels are exceeded.

ul.li: Provision the Corpus enterprise with devices provisioned in the Active state.
Subscribe the top-level management to the data bundle package of 1 TB data, and unlimited SMS or MMS services.
Configure all the levels with unlimited data sharing access.
Verify that an email is sent when the data consumption exceeds the threshold level defined per individual to notify that threshold level is exceeded.

Execute a CCR-I call for devices - Device1, Device2, and Device3. The call is successful for all three devices and Dynamic_Past_Usage is updated for three devices of group usage. All three devices are dormant after call execution, number of dormant lines after CCR-I is 3, and the requested units is allocated to these three devices.

Execute a CCR-I call for device (Device4). Call for Device4 is successful and the Device4 turns to dormant. The requested units is allocated to Device4 and number of dormant lines after the call is 4.

Execute a CCR-U1 call for Device4 with low usage. Call for Device4 is successful and the Device4 remains dormant. This shows the duration for which the low usage is allowed for low slice allocation. The Device4 counter1 is sum of usage done by Device4 from top-group Nokia. The Device4 counter2 is sum of usage done by all the devices from Nokia group.

Execute a CCR-U2 call for Device4 with high usage. Call for Device4 is successful and Device4 moves fromdormant to active state, which shows how the high usage allows for high slice allocation. The Device4 counter1 is sum of usage done by Device4 from top group Nokia. The Device4 counter2 is sum of usage done by all the devices from Nokia group. Verify that the notifications are sent when the consumption exceeds limits per device.

Execute a CCR-I call for Device5 and then excute a CCR-U call with overcommit, such that the milestone is about to be reached for group resource. Call for Device5 is successful and Device5 moves from dormant to active state. Verify that RAR is initiated for four devices (Device1, Device2, Device3, and Device4) for which reservation is done from group resource as last milestone is about to be reached. The Device5 counter1 is sum of usage done by Device5 from top-group Nokia. The Device5 counter2 is sum of usage done by all the devices from Nokia group resources. Verify that the notifications are sent when the consumption exceeds limits per device.
Initiate an SMS call for Device1 and Device2 devices and verify that SMS call is successful for all devices.
Initiate an MMS call for Device1 and Device2 devices and verify that MMS call is successful for all devices.

section.title: Provisioning

note.p: Ensure that after creating a record, you distribute it to ME. Otherwise, the provisioning will not be successful.

section.p:
Following entities are required for this use case. Entities for case 4
Entity Action
Notification preferences Select the notification channel as email.
Notification templates Create a notification template and define the text to send to devices when the usage exceeds the defined threshold.
Notification servers Configure a notification server.
Thresholds Create an absolute threshold for device and percentage threshold for milestone for dynamic slice.
Rates Create different rates for volume, money, unit.
Charging services
Create the following two charging services:
A charging service NokiaDataCS applicable to top-node only with a bucket of 1 TB.
A charging service applicable to all other nodes linked to rate created for volume.
Lifecycles Create lifecycles for accounts, devices, groups, and bundles.
Bundles Create bundles for three levels of hierarchy along with device bundle. Assign 1 TB of bucket only to the top-level node.
Slicing profile Create a slicing profile.
Counters Create counters, such as Nokia_Counter and Emp_Counter to track the data usage.
Custom data Create a GroupType custom data to associate with group.
Accounts Create individual and group accounts and associate them with entity name.
Groups Create group for three levels of hierarchy and associate lifecycle, for example, EnterpriseGroupLifeCycle in the current use case.
Devices Create the devices and associate them with device lifecycle.
Provision the following data from SM GUI:

ol.li: Create a notification profile with Channel = Email and Notification Type = THRESHOLD on the notification server.

Create a notification template with the text to be sent.
Parameter Value
Name Device_Data_Template
Notification priority Normal
Configure the notification server to send an email.

Create a device threshold following the given steps:
Navigate to Policy & Charging Configuration and select Common. Browse to select Thresholds tab from the drop-down list.
Click to create a threshold and configure the absolute start threshold profile as shown in the following figure:

Define the threshold percentage with empty rule container in the Thresholds entity for dynamic slicing:
Threshold Profile Group
Threshold Profile
Thresholds
Unit Type
Action
TPGMilestone
TP0 (PERCENTAGE)
Threshold1 (value=20)
Threshold2 (value=50)
Threshold3 (value=80)
Threshold4 (value=100)
VOLUME
Empty

Create different rates for volume, money, and unit.
Type Parameter Value
Volume Name R_Vol
Connection Cost 0
Rate Type Byte
Granularity level Byte
Unit Name R_Unit
Connection Cost 0
Rate Type Unit
Granularity level Unit
Money Name R_Mon
Connection Cost 0
Rate Type Money
Granularity level Money
Step for volume:
Step for unit:
Step for money:

Create the following charging services - NokiaDataCS and MainBalanceCS.
Create the charging service NokiaDataCS for top-level management and associate a data bucket as shown in the following figure:
Configure the tariff formula as shown in the following figure: Here, T_Data_Pass0.rule0 is for data, T_Data_Pass0.rule1 is for SMS, and T_Data_Pass0.rule2 is for MMS.
Create the charging service MainBalanceCS for remaining nodes (groups, accounts) and define the tariff as shown in the following figure:

Create the GroupType custom data that must be associated with the top-level group. To do this, navigate to Subscriber Manager and select the Custom Data tab. Click to create the custom data as shown in the following figure.

Create a slicing profile with the following parameters. To do this, navigate to Policy & Charging Configuration and select the Charging tab. Browse to select Slicing Profile from the drop-down list. Click to create the slicing profile as shown in the following figure.
Once the GroupType custom data with value Nokia is matched, the action defined in the slicing profile is executed. The dynamic slicing algorithm is used for optimized allocation of slice to the shared resources from the group to the devices. High usage devices get more slice whereas low usage or dormant devices get less slice allocated. If the GroupType of Nokia is not matched, then the values defined for slice size in the slicing profile is used.
Create the Nokia_Counter and Emp_Counter to track usage. To do this, navigate to Policy & Charging Configuration and select the Common tab. Browse to select Counters and click to create the counter.

Create the following lifecycles:
Create the DeviceLifeCycle with Active, Disconnected, PreActive, ActiveWarned, Expired states and associate it with devices.
Create the EnterpriseAccountLifeCycle with Disconnected, Active, Dormant, ActiveWarned, and Expired states and associate it with accounts.
Create the EnterpriseGroupLifeCycle with Active, Disconnected and Inactive states and associate it with groups.
Create the EnterpriseSubscriptionLifeCycle with Active, Disconnected, PreActive, and Inactive states and associate it with top-level bundle.
Create the MonthlySubsLC with Active, Disconnected, PreActive, and Inactive states and associate it with bundles for other nodes (groups, accounts, devices) in the hierarchy.

Create the bundles - NokiaBundle, FinanceBundle, FinanceManagerBundle, FinanceExecutive bundle, EngineeringBundle, EngineeringManagerBundle, EngineeringExecutiveBundle, SalesBundle, SalesManagerBundle, and SalesExecutiveBundle. To do this, navigate to Policy & Charging Configuration and select the Charging tab. Browse to select Bundles and click to create the bundle as shown in the following figure.

Subscribe all the devices in Corpus enterprise to the Nokia_Counter usage counter using AddDeviceGroupCounter. The Nokia_Counter usage counter tracks the data consumption of all individual devices.

Subscribe the top-level management in Corpus enterprise to the Emp_Counter usage counter using AddDeviceGroupCounter. The Emp_Counter usage counter tracks the data consumption of the top-level management. All the individual devices in Corpus consume resources from the top-level management.
